website_summaries.verdict: This little powerhouse easily sucks up stubborn pet hair and works on all types of surfaces.
pros: Includes two specially designed nozzles to help trap pet hair
Works on all floor types and upholstery
cons: The vacuum blows air out of the side, which can cause it to blow debris around instead of sucking it up

customer_reviews.title: You can make it great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful little vacuum, but it does have a few things that need to be improved. As other people have mentioned the vents are facing the sides which cause the wind to blow away the debris. This can be improved by making a cover that directs the air flow to the back of the vacuum. I used some brown paper bag to make my own, but you can use any material you like. Ideally this would be a 3D printed piece but that would cost too much. Wish they would fix this design issue in their next model.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on textured sofa
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this was going to work. I bought it based on all of the reviews, but it definitely did not work very well for me. . You can see from the pictures that it picked up very little hair after several minutes just on this one section of the sofa. You can barely tell the difference between the before and after photos. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: tara d.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired terrier, and her hair is on everything. I was looking for a vacuum for our furniture. This product works wonders on our recliner and our microfiber couch. One complaint people have is the high powered output of air (which is true), but for the purpose of removing pet hair from furniture it is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kretschmer

customer_reviews.title: Almost Impossible to Put Back Together After Emptying Cannister
customer_reviews.text: This did a great job picking up cat hair on the carpeted stairs. However, when I went to empty the cannister, it refused to go back together. I clicked in one side and the other side popped out. Clicked in the other side and the first side popped out. Read the manual. Did exactly as it indicated. Cannister would not pop back into the main unit. I don't care how well something works; if I have to fight with it to get it to do the job I purchased it to do, it's not a good value or a good product. Returning. I don't need to spend money for this kind of aggravation. :(
customer_reviews.author: Petnumber1

customer_reviews.title: Sucks... Not in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Well, I bought this specifically for the stairs in my apartment. I spent quite a bit of time comparing and reading reviews and this appeared to be my best bet. This vacuum sucks. And not in a good way. It barely picks up anything at all. It would probably work fine if there wasn't carpet, but I'm 100% disappointed and now have to buy yet another vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Stick to lintrollers
customer_reviews.text: I dont like how this gadget has a single purpose, and how it does not perform that single purpose well. I have a siberian husky, I love her dearly. Twice a year she sheds, and I can create carpeting for my entire 2000 sq ft house easy. If the hair is not loose or in chunks this thing will not suck it up. I wouldnt waste the time buying it unless for super light use. My dyson does an okay job but the only thing that will ever give you (or I) the results we desire is the good old fashioned lint roller.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Dog Parents
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepard and a husky who both shed their weight in fur every day. I was tired of taking my Shark up and down the stairs with all its attachments to just vacuum the stairs so I got this. I really had my heart set on a cordless one since its main purpose would be the stairs, but the reviews on cordless vacuums and pet hair were less than stellar. So, I took a chance on this Bissell Pet Hair Eraser and I'm glad I did. This little vacuum is AMAZING. This thing even picked up the hair the Shark left behind! I also use it for our comforters and couches. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: cynthia010

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and product did not deliver
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes after reading the review but unfortunately, after the initial test run, it didn’t do a good job of removing the fur from the carpet. While the vacuum was good in terms of suction, it did not remove any of the fur. As you can see from the two attached photos, it didn’t pull the fur off the carpet. Will have to return for one that does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Maven56

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordinarily buy and recommend Bissell...but not this time. This product was a waste of money and has stopped working...I have only had it a month. The suction power was not good, it was a little heavy for such a small vacuum and the pick up would have been better if I had sucked it up through a straw. Unfortunately, it's too late for me to return it and I am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Discount Diva

customer_reviews.title: Bissell Brand fails to live up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this vacuum based on the grand name. Unfortunately, for cat hair, or any other small job I have found, in the last year, that it is simply not worth it. The vents on the side blow anything you were trying to vacuum in the opposite direction. If you push with any amount of strength in an attempt to vacuum something off of a rug, couch, etc, the collection bin simply detaches, falls off, and spills everything you have vacuumed onto the floor... I have tried and tried to make it work. It simply does not. I think I will throw it away today.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet hair, wish it was cordless
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is really great for cleaning up pet hair. My old handheld was not able to suck my dog's hair from the couch cushions, and this one has no problem at all. I've cleaned my cloth kitchen chairs (yes my dog lays in them for some unknown reason) and the couch and was impressed with the suction. The only issue for me is the cord. It's fairly long, but it's still a bit of a drag to find an outlet in my older home to use this with. If it were cordless, it would literally be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little vacuum to use on my sofa to remove cat hair. It has great suction power but the exhaust portals on the sides blow away the debris I was trying to remove. I also felt the handle was inconvenient - it curves around the vacuum so you need to use one hand to maneuver it . The weight was such that I had to use both hands and it was awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a great work-out...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to return this but said it was to late. When I use this to pick up dog hair, the sides have some vent like whatever, which blows the dog air all over. You have to be fast and to catch the dog hair flying around the air. Never saw anything like this. It's a great work-out if you are into that because I get so hot chasing the flying dog hair in the air to get it. Bonus for me if I can catch it all! Waste of money, should of spent a little more for a Non-Chasing Dog Hair Picker Upper!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Turf

customer_reviews.title: Side Vents
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine FABRIC vaccuum, but buyer beware, if you have hard floors and need to vaccuum something quick, this is NOT the vaccuum for that. Because of the side vents, every hair within 5ft of you will be blasted into the abyss, never to be vaccuumed again until days later when the hairs find their new homes on your floors and furniture. The vents on the side release all of the air the vaccuum intakes. I don't know why someone would design the vaccuum this way, it doesn't make a whole lot of sense. Either way, wish I could return this thing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rene

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum works very well to get cat hair off furniture. It's no miracle machine--it takes a few passes to get all the hair off, especially on softer surfaces--but it's way better than my Shark's attachments, which hardly get anything. The soft nozzle scrapes the hair up so the vacuum can get it. I also use this on my carpeted stairs and it does a good job. The only thing I don't like about it is that it blows air sideways instead of out the back, so sometimes it blows what I want to vacuum into the air. They could have designed it with the vents angled back instead of straight out. But overall I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tasia in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Super powerful and a friend to anybody with a dog that sheds
customer_reviews.text: Two Golden Retrievers have met their match with dog hair pick up off furniture. This little machine works fantastic on furniture and even better in the car on the cloth seats. Where it fails miserably is the design flaw that blows air out of the side, thus blowing dirt and hair all over the place on hard surface floors. If you use it for the intended purpose, furniture, then this is the machine for you. If you are thinking this will pick up dog hair or dirt on hardwood floors or tile, you will be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoGirl

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this product because I have 2 indoor dogs and they both shed. I have a good shark vacuum, but it would not pick up the hair on my furniture. There are hairs that get embedded into the cushions, I guess due to the type of fabric. I even tried a shop type vac and it didn’t work much better than my Shark!! This little vacuum does exactly as described. It works fantastic!! I’m glad I decided to give it a try. If you are on the fence on whether or not to buy it, do so! At least with my experience, it is worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Good if don't have pets. I got as lighter than vacuum for stairs.
customer_reviews.text: Good if don't have pets. I got as lighter than vacuum for stairs. I waited awhile to try a couple times before reviewing. It does not get he hair off the steps as i had hoped. U vacuumed over the carpet on steps multiple times with both attachments and leaves a lot of the hair. Pro is that it is lighter than using a regular vacuum to do the stairs but not worth it if you want to get the pet hair up. Pictures. One before and one after.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic for pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: This compact little vacuum is AMAZING for picking up pet hair! I use it on my couch, ottoman, lamp shades, car, dog beds and anywhere else pet hair gets inbedded. I couldn't believe how well it works! It's very light and has a 16ft cord. The container is easy to pop off and dump out. It's also pretty good for picking up crumbs and dirt but nothing bigger than that. If you use it for it's intended purpose then it is a fantastic product and I swear by it.
customer_reviews.author: Snickle

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t live up to reviews
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this. It has thousands of awesome reviews... but I don’t understand why. this really didn’t clean my couch as well as I expected. My dog and cat both she’s like crazy but there was hardly any hair picked up with the vacuum. Some reviewers said it doesn’t work on their couch. Material, but I have a fabric couch that I’d think would work well with it... but I was let down. Also if the filter gets clogged the vacuum heats up dangerously fast. Was a waste of money for me. It doesn’t work on our furniture and because of the positioning of the fans I can’t use it on any hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Loved it after this..
customer_reviews.text: I listened to another review who recommended using a brown bag or other material around the vacuum to redirect the air flow from side vents to flow backwards which is extremely helpful when vacuuming up debris on hard surfaces. Otherwise, as others have mentioned, the air from the side vents just blows debris everywhere. I also have 2 cats and a Shiba Inu and this vacuum has worked wonders for cleaning up all their hair on the furniture, dog bed, cat tower, rugs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Keisha

customer_reviews.title: Great machine... long cord... vents need work.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I really want to give this vacuum 5 stars just for the weight and suction themselves. It’s a great machine. However, the side vents make getting loose material and hair up almost impossible. I’m going to rig something up to blow the air back like someone else did in another review. For the price, though, I’m really happy. Will be great for spot cleaning before house showings. We have 3 cats, and I do not want to drag out the large vacuum, or even the robot, for that. Oh, the cord is super long, too. I could reach across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Good for pet hair, but only that
customer_reviews.text: This does help with pet hair, though do note that I only have a guinea pig, not a dog or cat. Do heed the complaints about this vacuum blowing debris away from you when you are trying to vacuum it up. I tried a reviewer's suggestion of holding the vacuum upside down - it does not work. I tried making this work for me for 2 weeks, but ultimately I am fed up with it any I am looking for another vacuum to pick up after my guinea pig. This vacuum would be ok for pet hair because usually that is stuck onto something, so it won't get blown away by the vents.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Because of the rubbery attachment, this is the only thing that gets my pup's hair off of my furniture. The only thing I dont love about it is the ergonomics of it. My hand gets fatigued relatively quickly with it - but maybe that's just because my dog's hair gets really hooked into fabric and I have to really out a lot of muscle into it to lift that hair up. Its not too heavy, just seems that where the weight is from the motor, in comparison to the handle makes it a bit more difficult to use over a longer period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one month and seldom use it. Today I use it but it becomes hot after use for only 15 min and I let it rest for a while, then it never works again. I want to replace another one but just found three days beyond the return date. So so so so disappointed. This vacuum is pretty strong that is why I want to replace another. But I really hate one stop work for 1 month and bad service even can't replace.
customer_reviews.author: Hailing L.

customer_reviews.title: So close...
customer_reviews.text: After doing lots of research, I decided to go with this handheld vac. I was mostly worried about the suction in a handheld vac lacking, but with this unit, that is not the worry however. I bought this specifically to pick up all the hair my Czech Shepherd sheds, and like mentioned in every other review, the side vents make vacuuming a NIGHTMARE. I wish I could video the vents blowing his hair all around. I have to chase the hair around and try to suck it up while it’s whirling in the air. Wish I could return this, but I will try to find a way to make this work.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Returning product after a few try on our sofa. With 1 cat and a St Bernard I was hoping this would work well but while the rubber grabs do gather the hair well, the vacuum just doesn't seem to suck it up good at all. It is a small sweep as others had said so it does take a while to do sections but to me that's expected from most handhelds so I didn't factor that in my 1 star review. I currently use a small 5 gal shop vacuum and that does a better job minus the rubber grips. (if it had those it'd be perfect).
customer_reviews.author: Tami S

customer_reviews.title: Great on pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 (seven!) cats and a fluffy dog. Pet hair everywhere! I really didn’t believe this product would do much more than my regular vac but I was so, so wrong! It picks up 98% of the hair on my upholstery and bedding and 100% of the hair on flat surfaces. This is a powerful little vacuum with a long enough cord so I don’t have to keep plugging and unplugging to reach different areas. It’s easy to clean but does hold a lot of debris so I don’t have to empty it after each use. So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: JoyDesigns

customer_reviews.title: Good product...beware of seller description
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was fine. The description from Amazon Warehouse was the problem. I ordered the "like new" version. What I received was clearly used hard...it still had debris in it! Scuffed up and missing the manual. The vacuum itself is pretty awesome. Wanted something just for the stairs so I wasn't fighting the upright and hose. Love the little nubbies to help fluff the carpet and the top suction for the forward facing part of the stairs. Other reviews are correct. The side exhaust isn't helpful, but not sure what else they could've done. Saw a hack with a pair bag. Will try that out.
customer_reviews.author: HeartsandPonies

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove dig hair from the back side of our couch cushions and inside back of couch which apparently is covered in some kind of material that is virtually impossible to clean. It's almost like velcro. Anyway, this vacuum has a lot of suction, but could not get off the dog hairs. Also, it's not really good for cleaning your car carpets because you need a crevass tool for tight areas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought new but looks used and is dirty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product new but it came dirty and used. I wiped dirt off before thinking to take pictures, sadly. Even the chord and back of the machine which is not exposed by the open style packaging of the box (see picture of empty box) had scuffs, dirt, and some strange white stuff all over it. I bought this toward the end of November alongside Christmas gifts and now it is Christmas time so I don’t have the time/personal capability to return it. I’m very disappointed. The actual product is amazing for my German Shepherd’s hair. I just wish it was new/not dirty and scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats  don't recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small vacuum with plenty of power. However I wouldn't recommend it for someone with cats. The bulbous shape does not fit into spaces that cats like to hide it. I have a tall cat post with boxes for my cats and this vacuum does not fit into the boxes. The vacuum is not easy for someone with weak hands. Cat hair loves to stick to carpeting and this vacuum takes a lot of effort to actually move the cat hair.
customer_reviews.author: Bari Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Pulls up embedded hair, but the vacuum could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty torn on this one. The rubber attachment is FANTASTIC for pulling up hair. I have a Himalayan whose hair gets deeply embedded into everything and that attachment took care of it. That being said, the vacuum itself leaves a lot to be desired. The handle is placed at a really awkward and counterintuitive angle and it made my wrist hurt after just a few sweeps. I kept fidgeting with way to hold it and couldn’t find a different one that worked. The suction is pretty minimal and it gets hot fast. If I had to do it over again I’d just try and find a rubber comb like that to pull the hair up and skip the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Lane

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: It works so well I just love it! The suction is amazing and picks up everything. It also has enough cord you can cover a fairly large area like stairs. This works so much better and easier than the pathetic attachment to my vac. The only minor down side is that it picks up so much stuff I have to empty it fairly often but that also makes me happy that it does such a good job. I guess I am gushing because it is one product that has actually exceeded my expectations, so much so I gave it as Christmas gifts. Do yourself a favor and get it. You won't believe how often you will end up using it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Engert

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: its heavy for a hand vacuum and you will get an arm workout when you use it....( I count it as cardio lol) but it REALLY works. It takes some effort to remove pet hair off any fabric, but this works wonders! I use it a few times a week because my cats sheds A LOT and we have a slight allergy but it really does the job well. Highly recommend this vacuum. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Poor design with side exhausts that blow pet hair away before you can vacuum it up.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. The exhaust is on the sides and blows all of the pet hair away before I can get close enough to vacuum it up. Returned it after trying it in several different places around the apartment. Definitely didn't work on my comforter.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo C.

customer_reviews.title: Another Vote for BUY
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a pet hair issue. I have a wonderful little non-shedding Schnauzer. I have a toddler issue (twins!). So, I was looking for an inexpensive, small hand vacuum for the couch and to quickly clean up small, dry spills. My husband put this in the Amazon cart, so I purchased it. I love it. For the price, this thing is a dream. Honestly, it works as well any unit 3-4x as expensive. The suction is amazing. The cord is pretty long. Literally no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Pet hair savior.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is incredibleeeee. I have a mastiff and King Charles cavalier and both shed a lot. Particularly my mastiff who has very bristle like hair that gets stuck IN everything. We used it to vacuum our huge sectional couch and it got all the excess hair up. We also used it inside of our cars where we transported the dogs back and forth and it worked like a dream. Only bad thing is, with its shape it’s hard to get inside of small crevices or spaces that are hard to fit anything but a hose into. I highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kali G.

customer_reviews.title: Furniture and carpet surface only
customer_reviews.text: This is a good vaccuum for debris on stairs and furniture. When used on bare floor it actually blows random debris and hair around. Yes it will suck up what you are aiming for- but then creates other messes. I found myself chasing after tuffs of dog hair only to get them and see more. (Think mini leaf blower.) So now I only use it on furniture and stairs where it works well. The upside is that it does do very well on furniture and (carpeted) stairs and rugs, etc. Nice long cord too. Downside is price considering it is not used for much else besides furniture and stairs.
customer_reviews.author: shellyv

customer_reviews.title: Static electricity is stronger.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for a while and it's been adaquate. However, we just recently got a dog who sheds like crazy! Her hair is fine and tends to stick to everything. This vacuum is okay for thicker hair, but it seems static electricity holding the fine hair to the couch is stronger than the suction. I may need to find one with a brush roll.
customer_reviews.author: JHC

customer_reviews.title: The very best !! 5 * product
customer_reviews.text: If you do not have a hand vac..or ur looking for a better one..THIS IS IT FOLKS ! the suction power is incomparable... of all of owned I've never had a better stronger one. I have very very long shaggy carpet in my bed rm. And even our reg. Cac. Dont get it all. THIS DOES. And its quality built. I wanted a corded one so I'd have steady strong power. And I saw the ratings on this one so I couldnt pass it up. I'm glad I didnt ! It even arrived early ! It came the very next day !! So my ex po experience with this purchase was five star no doubt
customer_reviews.author: Teresa  Marie Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Best Handheld Vacuum for Pet Owners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after adopting another dog who sheds a whole lot! Our couch was constantly covered in dog hair and a normal vacuum suction tube just wouldn't do the trick and took forever! This handheld vacuum is designed specifically designed to pick up pet hair and does a great job! We use it on out couch and picks up the hair effortlessly. The other attachable nozzle designed to pick up hard messes (i.e. dog food or destroyed dog toys) is super effective as well. You don't have to worry about things getting stuck in your regular vacuum any more. I highly recommend this product for dog owners!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Walters

customer_reviews.title: I am not a paid reviewer
customer_reviews.text: So I have two dogs that I love. I also have two couches that I love. Both of which are covered in dog hair. I bought this handheld vacuum based on reviews. I was skeptical. I am also my father’s son and don’t like to admit when I am wrong. I was wrong. It’s awesome. Pet hair is gone. Couches look great. Amazingly powerful. Buying another for a friend because her dog is worse than mine and the shedding is insane. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Alberti

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Love this vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this vacuum been all my life? We adore our pets and have always had very furry, shedding animals. We currently have two terrier mixes and their fur is out of control. I have tried numerous vacuums, lint brushes, etc. for our upholstered furniture, and have never been satisfied with the results. This vacuum is by far the best I have had as far as pet fur. Some reviewers commented on the air that blows out of the side. Any vacuum with any power has this issue. I just vacuum from left to right. I would recommend this vacuum to anyone with furry animals.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Samantha J. Wechter

customer_reviews.title: Miracle worker
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't post reviews but this little vacuum is THE BEST THING EVER! I've struggled for years trying to remove cat hair from upholstered furniture and this vacuum was literally DONE in about 5 minutes. Seriously, I was so excited that I was looking for something else to use it on. I think it's the combination of really powerful suction and the soft rubber nozzle, but however Bissell created this vacuum, it's a miracle worker on pet hair. You will not be sorry you tried it and you will find yourself telling other fur parents about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Miller

customer_reviews.title: Pet Hair, No Eraser
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product. My shepherd/husky mix sheds like no tomorrow and, while I have hardwood floors and my Swiffer does just fine in those areas, I do have carpet on the stairs leading up to my bedroom that is heavily trafficked by my Marley and needed something to handle that area. When I used this, I found that I did just as much work, if not more, than I do with a regular vacuum or just sweeping it with a broom. This may fair well for short haired dogs, or even those that do not shed as much as mine. I had no choice but to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: ASBSMS

customer_reviews.title: A Really GREAT Tool
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats. It's "shedding" season. Receive the Hair Eraser last night. It sucked up more cat hair of our carpets and furniture that could be imagined. The fibers were invisable to the eye or just faint before vacuuming. I had to empty the collection chamber TWICE after only an hour and a half needed to to every surface. Our Rumba takes care of the bare floors for us. My regular vacuum (a Sharp Regal Professional), I thought was efficient. The Hair Eraser is 100% better at getting the cat hair. This is the ONE you need! Don't just check me, check out Consumer Reports!
customer_reviews.author: MR. LARRYSOLD

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, but could use a better design
customer_reviews.text: I agree with what people are saying about how air isn't directed well. If you aren't careful it will blow what you are attempting to vacuum all over the place. I have gotten used to placing my hand over one side while I approach what I want to sweep up at an angle. Otherwise I really like this for suction power. Cleaning the filter is a bit messy though, and I wish it came with a crevice tool, but I'm happy to leave my cordless hand vacs behind and not have to worry about batteries wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: MaggiePie

customer_reviews.title: Best for us of all the options.
customer_reviews.text: We tested this vacuum literally right out of the box. I bought it specifically for stairs but also for quick pickup in spot areas. Since it had been nearly a month since the stairs had been done there was a lot to be cleaned up with both shedding dog and cat. Admittedly, we filled the canister cup three times before we were done. That's the great part. The only issues I have is that the attachments are plastic and pop on. That may not wear as well if they are clipped in place. The other issue I have is how fast the filter filled with dirt, potentially lessening the drawing power of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: cmberman

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog fur
customer_reviews.text: Mainly got a hand-held vacuum so I can collect do fur on couches, the bed, the floor, the AIR, etc. When you own a Corgi, shedding becomes a non-ending issue. This vacuum does it's job. It's easy to clean. The wire is long enough that I can move around without switching to a different outlet too often. I will say I wish it didn't blow dust/fur away while I'm vacuuming (causes the process to last a little longer). But for the price, I am okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Fatal design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum exhausts out both sides of the motor and blows hair absolutely EVERYWHERE! As you're trying to suck up hair and dust, it's being blown away from you by the turbo speed air coming out the sides of the unit. Product testing should have revealed this in a 30-second trial... Duh! Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution - great price!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product because I’ve tried everything for dog hair on the couch (beagles whose short, wiry hair seems to get imbedded like a bad sliver) and nothing seemed to be a great solution. I’ve even tried spraying the couch first with static guard. This thing works great. See photos. I’m impressed and the price is right! First photo shows hair on left and cleaned on right and the 2nd photo closer up of hairy cushion and 3rd post quick clean.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work, but it does not do much of anything. Unfortunately, there is no roller brush on this vacuum. It is like trying to get cat fur off furniture using only a vacuum wand. I think if it had a roller brush it might work.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Not even kidding, this is the best thing I have found to get rid of my dogs hair in my house. And I have tried it all, I'm pretty sure. I have a Shiba Inu, which sheds daily and also blows his coat twice a year... And all of my couches are a dark gray fabric (my dog is tan) and oh my gosh so much hair always. I even have the Shark vacuum with a pet hair attachment and this works sooooo much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a green couch set and a white dog and it drives me crazy!!!! He gets hair all over everything and I have tried everything. Although lint rollers work it takes 30 sheets to do one cushion on the couch, I got this today and already did both couches and it is amazing, It is easy to use, leaves no loose hair on or around the vacuum like a lot of them do and picks up almost every last hair. I have not tried it as a regular vacuum or to pick anything but pet hair up but I bought it for this purpose only so I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: L Davis

customer_reviews.title: So many negatives, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: So many cons for this little vacuum I'm not sure how it has such good reviews. Yes it is a strong vacuum but sooo many negatives that it just isnt worth it. It's very inconvenient to hold the way the handle is mounted. There is such strong airflow from both sides of the vacuum that everything I was trying to suck up was simply being blown all over the place defeating the entire purpose. Also most reviews and images show this coming with many attachments to vacuum certain areas, but none of these were included...
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let the price fool you, it really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is awesome. Bought it to replace my Dyson ball Animal 2. I was worried it wouldn’t work as well as the Dyson, especially for the low price. I was pleasantly surprised to find this little vacuum works really well for spot cleaning our couch and blankets. We have 2 golden retrievers and to say they shed a lot is an understatement. We vacuum every day, sometimes twice a day. We wanted a more hands free approach so we replaced our Dyson with a Eufy robovac that runs daily and we bought this Bissell handheld to clean hair off the furniture. I recommend this to anyone looking for a smaller and affordable vacuum foe pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Versatile & very strong suction
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome to clean up cat hair off anything. Also use to vacuum air conditioner vents & filters & regular vacuum cleaner filters than are reusable. Very strong pickup power. I like having 2 attachments bc one works great things like furniture & cushions & the other is good for hard surfaces & corners or tight places. I like it being hand held bc is more versatile & portable to use in more places. Prefer the cord instead of having to recharge & worry about battery replacements . Has nice long cord.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: WOW- amazing!
customer_reviews.text: SO happy I bought this. I have three Australian Shepherds and five cats..... My life is a CONSTANT battle against hair. I have a dyson, but the hand attachment for hair does not work. I decided to get this because of the reviews.... WOW I always knew silicone was the trick of getting up dog hair, but I get sick of ruining expensive oven mitts! Then having to vacuum up what I just gathered with the mitts. Lifesaving product for me! AND it gets the dander up from the dog beds, too!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Kelley

customer_reviews.title: It is a good workout
customer_reviews.text: Meaning it takes me 45 minutes to vacuum my couch. It works pretty well for long, fluffy cat hair, but I now have a dog...lab mix, to be exact and let's just say it has no power over those little quill-like hairs. I have to shop for something new. Same complaint as the others, the side vents blow debris everywhere. Hoping they fix this design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L. Heise

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning upholstery - Air flow could use a redesign
customer_reviews.text: Works great for cleaning upholstery and pillows. It doesn't do as great a job on these microfiber soft pillow cases but it's pretty powerful for a hand vac. The design of it though has the air output going out sideways which tends to blow away things you're about to suck. You have to work around the airflow issue but otherwise pretty solid and pretty great at this price point ($30). It was pretty easy to use if a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Simmons

customer_reviews.title: awesomne
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased every brush/gadget to remove pet hair from furniture and nothing works. Decided to try this based on reviews but did not have high expectations, boy was I ever wrong, this little machine blew my mind. From the second I started on my sofa I could not believe my eyes, the pet hair was just disappearing with almost no effort. the vacuum does all the work, my sofa looks like new again, not a hair in sight, I could not be more pleased. I HAVE NOT received anything for this review, please believe me when I say that it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: THE ANSWER TO MY PRAYERS!
customer_reviews.text: According to my wife this small but powerful vacuum is the answer to her prayers! We have a Carolina dog who is the worst shedding dog I’ve ever had, our couch and pillows are constantly covered but this little vacuum solved those problems. Definitely a MUST for couches & chairs if you have pets that are bad shedders. Our couch is gray so it’s hard to show before and after pictures, but the before and after pictures on other reviews are VERY accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little vacuum that does what it's suppose to
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little vacuum that does very well with pet hair. The down fall is the blowers tend to blow things around a bit too much that they designed on the sides. There is a review out there that came up with the idea of putting a paper bag on the blowers to help with blowing things around that I haven't tried yet. I would recommend this to people with pet hair problems that a regular vacuum can't get up. This has a silicone attachment with comb like edging to help get up pet hair stuck in fabric and also another attachment that's a plastic flat edge.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great on dog hair, and small enough for my 6 year old daughter to help on the carpeted stairs!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that this actually works on pet hair, since it doesn't have a power roller brush. But the price was so low, and it had so many good reviews I gave it a shot. Had it for a few days and it's working great so far. My daughter is loving that she can help now, and it's doing a great job on the hairy stairs. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet hair
customer_reviews.text: It picked up so much! I used it on a rug in my hallway. It did take a lot of effort scrubbing the nozzle on the rug but it picked up so much hair and dirt. The side vents ARE a problem. They blow dust bunnies and hair away from the vacuum which seems like an idiotic design flaw. I swear another buyer taped paper bags to the sides to redirect the air so I'll just do that. Everything has some flaws and the suction and pick up power of this vac is worth this small one.
customer_reviews.author: sara miller

customer_reviews.title: Best fur removal vac I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Bought this out of desperation to remove my German shepherds shedding coat from the back of my suv. I’ve tried my shop vac, the house vac, a little vac with a rotating head, lint brush and gaffers tape with only mixed levels of success for way too much effort. Got this and immediately tried it and was completely surprised on how well it worked removing virtually all the hair and how quickly I was able to do it. Works great. Easy to use, long cord and easy to empty. Best vac I’ve ever used for fur removal.
customer_reviews.author: Paul - Newburyport, MA

customer_reviews.title: Not anything special for pet hair problems
customer_reviews.text: I have a Lab, fell for some of the review hype thinking this might be great for pet hair. Used it in my car this weekend after taking a 3 day trip with dog. Lots of hair on rug. Was a tedius process, same as any other hand held cord vac I've used for this problem, didn't make it any easier. Tried it on the stairs in the house, same mediocre opinion of ability to do something for pet hair. I'll keep it since I currently don't have a hand held cord vac, but if you're thinking this might be great on pet hair - it's not any different from others, disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Franks

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED THIS
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for 6 months now. I bought this because I have 2 Great Pyrenees. What’s a Great Pyrenees you ask? It’s a giant guinea pig of a dog. And my guinea pigs loooove sleeping on my orange couch. The couch is white after they’re done with it. This vacuum is insane, I’d be losing it over all this hair had I not bought this item.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Pleszewski

customer_reviews.title: Great for your staircase!
customer_reviews.text: Went on the hunt for a little lightweight handheld vacuum that had a cord. I'm tired of battery powered tools and all the hassle of charging them and batteries that don't last, or hold a charge. This one has a nice long cord, is fairly lightweight, and easy to use. Great suction on this machine! It picks up hair and fur right out of the carpet. The filter is really easy to remove and clean. It does vent/blow out the sides like everyone has mentioned in their reviews, so for that reason, not sure it would work great on solid surfaces like wood/tile. I'm giving it 5 stars because for carpet use alone, this is working out perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: My Blue heeler mix sheds year round and it’s always all over the place. Places I never even knew hair could be lol! So far I have used it on the bed, baseboards, blankets, window sills, and more. Great suction power. I do wish it came with a car charger or longer cord so I could use it for the seat covers in our cars. The rubber part can be a little challenging to use as well but overall effective product!
customer_reviews.author: kokolove

customer_reviews.title: BEST PET HAIR VACUUM .. even sucks the dust out and our couch is only a year old !!
customer_reviews.text: BEST PET HAIR VACUUM.. .. any of the reviews that say otherwise.. it’s user error !! Which I can’t understand because it’s so easy .. I struggled and purchased all sorts of crap trying to find a solution to my dog hair on couch issue.. our boxer mix has short hair and gets stuck in the couch fibres .. THIS VACUUM IS AMAZING !!!!! We literally leave it plugged in beside the couch .. we have a Lovesac couch .. for reference
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The noise has scared the dogs off the sofa. Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this works in two ways: 1st. The nozzle easily grabs the hair, even when the hair is seemingly stuck in the sofa fabric. 2nd. This machine is so loud my dogs couldn’t leave the room fast enough. A funny side effect is as long as the vacuum is sitting quietly on the sofa, the dogs have decided their own beds are more comfortable than the sofa. Win Win! Seriously, I like this vacuum. I may buy one to pose on my hair filled bed. Yes it sounds like there’s a jet engine warming up in your living room, but funnily enough it gets out the dog hair with not a lot of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Dahbee

customer_reviews.title: Little vacuum that could!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave a review with a video but with this vacuum, I felt the need to coz it works so well. My dogs rub up behind our couch all the time especially when they play fight and this little vacuum that could sucked it all out. You really need to vacuum in a flat ngle to really get the full benefit, I did a poor job of that in the video lol. But I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jowii

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful. I bought the CrossWave which has no attachments and so I needed something to get the dog hair off my couch. I don’t use the silicone attachment but the plastic attachment is amazing. It takes roughly 10 minutes to clean my sectional and my loveseat. I even clean my throw pillow s with it and it’s so quick. I love bissell pet products and this one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Best handheld vacuum for furniture
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I was super excited to get this vacuum but I tried to keep my expectations low as I have 2 large dogs that shed like crazy. I have a Dyson pet vacuum for regular use but was struggling to keep our new couch relatively hair less. And let me tell you, this did not disappoint!!!!! I LOVE THIS vacuum. It is PERFECT for furniture. I will warn it’s not like a huge difference the first time and you gotta use a little arm work to get it all but it is a WORLD of a difference and it will get it. LOVE IT. If you have pets you need this in your life
customer_reviews.author: Ambre

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute life saver. My little dog sheds and my fairly new couch was starting to get ugly. Tried a few other products and it was too much work for little reward. This little thing is great! I thought the cord would hinder me but it seems to go a long way!
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Great to vacuum the hard to get small stray fur on everything!
customer_reviews.text: Love the suction & how it sucks up my dog’s long fur that is stuck to our bedding, etc! Only thing is, if there’s loose fur (like after shaving my Dog’s fur), it blows the fur around the room because the side of the vacuum blows out, but once you just gather (already gathered) fur on my bed, it gets the small hard to get stray hairs very well! Highly recommend this product! Because my problem was not the easy to gather loose fur, it was the hard to get small stray fur on all the furniture, bedding, my car & even on my clothes. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Great at picking up pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so at under $40, I didn’t expect too much. I was not only surprised, but amazed. I have a German Shepard, so shedding is a real thing. I mean hair everywhere, even where she hasn’t been. I don’t like wearing dog hair or seeing it on my floors. I like things to be clean. I started with the stairs and they have never looked better! I mean, my carpet has not been cleaner since getting a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: A must have for cat parents
customer_reviews.text: I love this little handheld vacuum. The main reason for my purchase is I have one of those cat mats underneath the litter box you know the kind to trap the litter off their paws before they drag it around the house. Well the litter gets trapped in the mat and my very good regular vacuum has a hard time cleaning off that mat. I love this vacuum for a few reasons. A. It's a Bissell, B. The flexible head on the vacuum, I can push it down into the mat to get the litter, C. It has CRAZY good suction. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jone

customer_reviews.title: A must have if your dog sheds!
customer_reviews.text: My dog sheds like crazy. He is always getting on my bed and leaving a pile of dog hair behind. The suction is great and the little rubber bumps lift up the hair that gets imbedded in the fabric so the suction can suck it up. It's also very light weight and the cord is plenty long.
customer_reviews.author: BJI

customer_reviews.title: Can have dog AND couch!
customer_reviews.text: We stopped using our couch because of the dog hair. She's 7 years old (the dog, not the couch) and we couldn't go back in time to get her to stay off the couch. Being supremely lazy, I also didn't try much to get her hair off fabric of any kind. If it doesn't come off in the wash, with a lint brush, or the extension wand on the vacuum cleaner, I figure it's my fate. But this little machine CHANGED EVERYTHING. I just spent 30 minutes using this thing and the couch is hair-free. Totally worth the $35.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work well for picking up pet hair (as that’s it’s intended use). However, it doesn’t work well for picking up anything else because as other people said it blows all the debris away...but I didn’t get it for that, I got it to get all the cat hair off my furniture, so for that it works. The only thing I would say is it can start to feel a bit heavy if you have a lot of vacuuming to do, and you definitely get an arm workout with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jewelry Lover

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is amazing. I have 3 dogs, and one of them is a long haired border collie/Australian Shepherd mix so she had very long hair and is always shedding. I keep my sectional couch covered with dog blankets and use this everyday on all furniture even our leather couch and this cleans all the hair right up. So much suction power from something so little. I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Tara H

customer_reviews.title: Requires buying too many filter replacements
customer_reviews.text: The product itself doesn't cost much and has very good suction when the filter is new, but the filters get dirty rather quickly and it's possible to clean them only partially, so you'll be buying a lot of replacement filters. Also it's not very comfortable to use since you need to hold it and drag it across surfaces which is tiring, and the air it emits blows all the near by dust and hair to various directions. In the end I think it better to just get a more expensive vacuum cleaner without filters.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sheinker

customer_reviews.title: easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. I exhaust myself carting my full-size vacuum to the couch, cat tree, chair, whatever my cats have shed all over. This thing pulls hair fantastically (and within realistic parameters*) and is so light-weight, easy to maneuver, nice long cord, etc. ** More on "Realistic Parameters": My cat tree has fur basically smooshed into crevices. I think my cats shed and then stuff it in as hard as they can. This vacuum will loosen the ends, but it doesn't have the power to pull it out unless I give it a tug to help.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It works and is a great value!
customer_reviews.text: It works wonderfully. It’s reasonably priced. It works wonderfully. I mean seriously that rubber tip is genius! I had been using a pumice stone to scrape white dog hair off of a black Persian rug and it started to get damaged. This is literally perfect for getting up pet hair with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.... you will NOT regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Wow just wow! I have tried my home vacuum, it would get some fur, but not imbedded fur. I had fur imbedded into my comforter, sheets, pillow case, and furniture.... this little vacuum is AMAZING! It exceeded my expectations. I read some reviews and decided to give it a chance. If it worked great, if not I would have used it for the car. However, it WORKED and I would recommend this product to anyone that has an animal and are looking for a reliable, durable, and a vacuum that actually works as it claims too. Many products say a lot, but end up not doing what is expected.... this worked as expected!!
customer_reviews.author: Somer Barnthouse

customer_reviews.title: Where did the hair go?
customer_reviews.text: Between my long hair, my Australian Shepherd/lab mix, and a beautiful calico cat we collectively shed a full head of hair daily. I have three broken/unusable vaccumes in the house that couldn’t keep up (even a Dyson). This little guy WORKS! One sweep on the couch and ALL THE HAIR IS GONE! I’m pulling black dog hair one of the rugs I thought were tainted forever. The backseat of my car looks brand new. Y’all... even my black workout pants I’m currently wearing are pet hair free for the first time in forever (I had to try it)! If you love your animals but hate the hair everywhere get this Joe!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie D.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy cleanups
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Bissell Eraser Hand held vaccum - and I love it. It took me less than 5 minutes to clean up litter that my fur baby had tracked outside her litter box, and to do the stairs. It is an excellent investment for the money. So glad I got the corded hand vaccum instead of paying four or five times more for cordless. I realized all the places I need it are close to an electrical outlet, so I went with a corded one. If I ever need it further away, I'll use my 25 ft orange extension cord to expand its reach.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth - The Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does pick up a lot of pet hair. I do have a couple of issues with it, though. It's heavy for something as small as it is. And I found it quite awkward to use both because of the weight and the configuration of the handle both of which probably are designed that way for a reason but that doesn't make them good for the user. The cord is long and that's a good thing but it seems unnecessarily heavy -- heavier than my regular vacuum. This vacuum is something I unfortunately won't use as often as I need to.
customer_reviews.author: ElizaB

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: It works great to clean stairs, picks up everything well, and the little silicon "fingers" really reach into the corners. It is not too heavy, has a nice LONG cord, and a reasonable-sized collection container, and is not too loud. It is easy to empty. The only slight downside I have found is that it gets rather warm after using it on a few stairs, so I let it "rest" in the middle to cool down, just to be sure I don't overheat it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Israel

customer_reviews.title: mehhh, IDK what to think of this. I ...
customer_reviews.text: mehhh, IDK what to think of this. I bought it solely to pick up cat litter around the liter box that gets on the floor. I didn't want to keep using the regular vacuum that I use on the rest of the house for sanitary reasons. I am aware it is advertised as a pet hair vacuum , but in the pics it shows the attachment comes off and used to pick up litter. the problem is, the litter comes out of the opening and gets on the floor. its also a pain to empty bc the filter comes out and has to put in just right to close it back up. I wish I would have gotten something different.
customer_reviews.author: SS359

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this because nothing ever works well on getting the pet hair off of my furniture, clothes, floors, curtains etc etc. I guess that’s what I get for having two long haired cats and a lab. But after my chargeable vacuum went out, I decided to get this one. I am SHOCKED that it works so well. And amazed at how powerful it is for the price. Now, it doesn’t get every single piece of hair off my comfortable but I’d say 80 to 90%. Way more than anything else I’ve used. It does better than my regular vacuum that has a pet brush attachment. This is a great product! Especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Cb1

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction, very efficient, great price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for pet hair. IMO if you want powerful suction, get a corded vacuum. It is ideal for vacuuming upholstered furniture. It’s nozzle is great for getting into the crevices and works well with curved nature of the cushions and furniture. One or two swipes and the cat hair is gone. My previous cordless one required several swipes and still didn’t get the hair off completely. And so cheap! Glad I didn’t invest in a Dyson. No need to spend all that money.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: YESSSSSSSSSS!!!!!! Hair be gone!
customer_reviews.text: I love this!!! I have a white german shepherd and she has a spot on the side of my charcoal colored upholstered bed that she loves to lay against and it had become so grossly covered in her hair that I was losing it. I tried SO many other 'dog hair remover' methods and none fully removed the hair but this vacuum did! I tried both of the attachments and was shocked that the regular one worked as good as the rubber one. I think it's because there is so much suction power. The CONS: I HATE the handle and you'll want to modify the vents so that the air pushes behind vs so strongly on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Came slightly damaged, but Pet Hair Beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is legit one of the best cleaning tools ever! I have a beagle and am constantly sweeping, mopping, and vacuuming. I didn’t realize how much hair my regular vacuum wasn’t picking up until I bought this. The picture is hair from just my steps! I had my family over later that day and everyone asked if I had the steps professionally cleaned, they looked that good! Only downside is that it is a little awkward to handle and use. 4 stars because the product came scratched, really dusty, and a bit banged up, looks like it got knocked around the warehouse quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Hankins

customer_reviews.title: Works great for pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: We have had problems with cat hair on the duvet and sofa. She sheds like you would not believe, we run our Roomba for her fur on the carpets daily and the chamber fills up every time. This handheld vacuum is a serious game-changer for our furniture. Super powerful suction and the rubber nubs on the end really do comb the hair out of upholstery. As the other reviews state, this thing is loud, but it makes sense with how powerful this thing is. Very easy to dump out the hair after, and the long cord is excellent if you don't have a socket close by to plug into. This vacuum will solve your pet hair problems on any fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lahiff

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I purchased to use to detail clean around my cat's litter box and food area. Has great suction and is very easy to empty and clean the filter. My first night of use, I used it for a good half hour straight (I went a little crazy trying to see exactly what nooks and crannies I could get into) and the motor overheated and shut off. I was a touch worried but the next morning I plugged it in and it worked just fine. So good safety feature! Years ago I had a full sized Bissell Pet Hair Vac and it was fantastic, this hand vac lives right up to my experience with the fullsize.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful vacuum for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job for a cheap vacuum. I was worried about the sound but it's really not that bad. Cord is plenty long and comes with a velcro strap to tie it up when you're not using it. Does a great job on my couches. The rubber tips left marks on my leather chair but it rubbed off. The marks were similar to a pencil eraser left overs. Clean up is easy. One button opens up the container and the filter stays in the container so you don't have to worry about pet hair flying out when opening it. Then slide the filter out and you can dump the hair into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Pelsssss

product_meta.title: Bissell Pet Hair Eraser Handheld Vacuum, Corded, 33A1
product_meta.description:
Style Name:VacuumDesigned especially for pet hair pick-up around the house, this handheld vacuum cleaner delivers the power needed for fast results. It features a flexible rubber contour nozzle that effectively removes dirt and pet hair from upholstery and stairs. Buying this product saves pets. Bissell proudly supports Bissell Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a Bissell product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.

AMAZON.COM


BISSELL PET HAIR ERASER HAND VAC, 33A1

Designed especially for pet hair pick-up around the house, this handheld vacuum cleaner delivers the power needed for fast results. The unit comes equipped with a flexible rubber contour nozzle that effectively removes dirt and pet hair from upholstery and stairs, plus a hard nozzle for cleaning dry messes or the inside of automobiles. Switch out one nozzle for the other by pressing down on the round nozzle-release button and snapping the new nozzle into place. The vacuum cleaner offers lightweight construction at less than 4 pounds, a comfortable easy-grip handle, and a fingertip-access on/off switch. Its dirt container should be emptied after each use to ensure maximum suction performance. Other highlights include a pleated post motor filter, a filter screen, and a 16-foot power cord with a cord-wrap system. The handheld vacuum cleaner measures approximately 10 by 5 by 8 inches and carries a one-year limited warranty.

 * Includes two specially designed nozzles
 * Specialized rubber nozzle attracts hair and pulls out dirt on areas such as stairs and upholstery
 * Effectively picks up dry messes on many surfaces
 * Lightweight; mobile for those tasks for around the house 
 * Powerful; convenient for quick, easy clean up 
 * Versatile; Contour nozzle pulls out dirt and hair on areas such as stairs and upholstery
 * Multi-Level Filtration
 * 16 ft Power cord 
 * 1-year limited warranty 




BISSELL STICK AND HAND VACUUM COMPARISON
Featherweight Vacuum, 3106

Lift-Off Floors & More, 53Y8

Lift-Off Floors & More PET, 53Y8-1

PowerEdge PET Hard Floor Vacuum, 81L2-T

Pet Hair Eraser Corded Hand Vac, 33A1

CleanView Deluxe Corded Hand Vac, 47R5

Pet Hair Eraser Cordless Hand Vac, 94V5-A
